intro: Linaria koesensis, commonly known as the Koesen's toadflax, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branching. Linaria koesensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its striking blooms.
